cwd.description: The current working directory of the executed program or script. If omitted Code's current workspace root is used.

env.description: The environment of the executed program or shell. If omitted the parent process' environment is used.

oneOf.errorMessage: Unrecognized problem matcher. Is the extension that contributes this problem matcher installed?

base.description: The name of a base problem matcher to use.

owner.description: The owner of the problem inside Code. Can be omitted if base is specified. Defaults to 'external' if omitted and base is not specified.

source.description: A human-readable string describing the source of this diagnostic, e.g. 'typescript' or 'super lint'.

severity.description: The default severity for captures problems. Is used if the pattern doesn't define a match group for severity.

applyTo.description: Controls if a problem reported on a text document is applied only to open, closed or all documents.

anyOf.description: The name of a contributed or predefined pattern

regexp.description: The regular expression to find an error, warning or info in the output.

kind.description: whether the pattern matches a location (file and line) or only a file.

file.description: The match group index of the filename. If omitted 1 is used.

location.description: The match group index of the problem's location. Valid location patterns are: (line), (line,column) and (startLine,startColumn,endLine,endColumn). If omitted (line,column) is assumed.

line.description: The match group index of the problem's line. Defaults to 2

column.description: The match group index of the problem's line character. Defaults to 3

endLine.description: The match group index of the problem's end line. Defaults to undefined

endColumn.description: The match group index of the problem's end line character. Defaults to undefined

severity.description: The match group index of the problem's severity. Defaults to undefined

code.description: The match group index of the problem's code. Defaults to undefined

message.description: The match group index of the message. If omitted it defaults to 4 if location is specified. Otherwise it defaults to 5.

loop.description: In a multi line matcher loop indicated whether this pattern is executed in a loop as long as it matches. Can only specified on a last pattern in a multi line pattern.

Assigns the task to no group

isDefault.description: Defines if this task is the default task in the group, or a glob to match the file which should trigger this task.

defaultSnippets.description: Marks the task as the default build task.
Marks the task as the default test task.

group.description: Defines to which execution group this task belongs to. It supports "build" to add it to the build group and "test" to add it to the test group.

isBackground.description: Whether the executed task is kept alive and is running in the background.

promptOnClose.description: Whether the user is prompted when VS Code closes with a running task.

presentation.description: Configures the panel that is used to present the task's output and reads its input.

echo.description: Controls whether the executed command is echoed to the panel. Default is true.

focus.description: Controls whether the panel takes focus. Default is false. If set to true the panel is revealed as well.

enumDescriptions: Always reveals the problems panel when this task is executed.
Only reveals the problems panel if a problem is found.
Never reveals the problems panel when this task is executed.
revealProblems.description: Controls whether the problems panel is revealed when running this task or not. Takes precedence over option "reveal". Default is "never".

enumDescriptions: Always reveals the terminal when this task is executed.
Only reveals the terminal if the task exits with an error or the problem matcher finds an error.
Never reveals the terminal when this task is executed.
reveal.description: Controls whether the terminal running the task is revealed or not. May be overridden by option "revealProblems". Default is "always".

panel.description: Controls if the panel is shared between tasks, dedicated to this task or a new one is created on every run.

showReuseMessage.description: Controls whether to show the `Terminal will be reused by tasks, press any key to close it` message.

clear.description: Controls whether the terminal is cleared before executing the task.

group.description: Controls whether the task is executed in a specific terminal group using split panes.

close.description: Controls whether the terminal the task runs in is closed when the task exits.

icon.description: An optional icon for the task

id.description: An optional codicon ID to use

color.description: An optional color of the icon

hide.description: Hide this task from the run task quick pick

cwd.description: The current working directory of the executed program or script. If omitted Code's current workspace root is used.

env.description: The environment of the executed program or shell. If omitted the parent process' environment is used.

shell.description: Configures the shell to be used.

problemMatcher.description: The problem matcher(s) to use. Can either be a string or a problem matcher definition or an array of strings and problem matchers.

reevaluateOnRerun.description: Whether to reevaluate task variables on rerun.

runOn.description: Configures when the task should be run. If set to folderOpen, then the task will be run automatically when the folder is opened.

instanceLimit.description: The number of instances of the task that are allowed to run simultaneously.

anyOf.description: Another task this task depends on.
The other tasks this task depends on.

dependsOn.description: Either a string representing another task or an array of other tasks that this task depends on.

enumDescriptions: Run all dependsOn tasks in parallel.
Run all dependsOn tasks in sequence.
dependsOrder.description: Determines the order of the dependsOn tasks for this task. Note that this property is not recursive.

detail.description: An optional description of a task that shows in the Run Task quick pick as a detail.

file.description: The Gulp file that provides the task. Can be omitted.

taskName.deprecationMessage: The task's name property is deprecated. Use the label property instead.

identifier.description: A user defined identifier to reference the task in launch.json or a dependsOn clause.
identifier.deprecationMessage: User defined identifiers are deprecated. For custom task use the name as a reference and for tasks provided by extensions use their defined task identifier.
